title: Standard Zn-Ag Galvanic cell - overall reaction

content.description:
Standard reduction potentials for the half-reactions associated with the electrochemical cell shown above are given in the table below.

Half-Reaction
 <math alttext="E naught, in volts" overflow="scroll" xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"><mstyle><mrow><mi>E</mi><mi>°</mi><mrow><mspace depth="0.0ex" height="0.0ex" width="0.2em"></mspace><mo>(</mo><mtext>V</mtext><mo>)</mo></mrow></mrow></mstyle></math>

<math alttext="A g with a positive 1 charge, aqueous, plus 1 electron, react to produce A g, solid" overflow="scroll" xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"><mstyle><mrow><msup><mrow><mtext>Ag</mtext></mrow><mrow><mo>+</mo></mrow></msup><mrow><mo>(</mo><mi>a</mi><mi>q</mi><mo>)</mo><mo>+</mo><msup><mrow><mi>e</mi></mrow><mrow><mo>−</mo></mrow></msup><mo>→</mo></mrow><mtext>Ag</mtext><mrow><mo>(</mo><mi>s</mi><mo>)</mo></mrow></mrow></mstyle></math>
 <math alttext="positive 0.80" overflow="scroll" xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"><mrow><mrow><mstyle><mrow><mo>+</mo><mn>0.80</mn></mrow></mstyle></mrow></mrow></math>

<math alttext="Z n with a positive 2 charge, aqueous, plus 2 electrons, react to produce Z n, solid" overflow="scroll" xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"><mstyle><mrow><msup><mrow><mtext>Zn</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn><mo>+</mo></mrow></msup><mrow><mo>(</mo><mi>a</mi><mi>q</mi><mo>)</mo><mo>+</mo><mn>2</mn><mspace depth="0.0ex" height="0.0ex" width="0.1em"></mspace><mspace depth="0.0ex" height="0.0ex" width="0.1em"></mspace><msup><mrow><mi>e</mi></mrow><mrow><mo>−</mo></mrow></msup><mo>→</mo><mtext>Zn</mtext><mrow><mo>(</mo><mi>s</mi><mo>)</mo></mrow></mrow></mrow></mstyle></math>
 <math alttext="negative 0.76" overflow="scroll" xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"><mrow><mrow><mstyle><mrow><mo>−</mo><mn>0.76</mn></mrow></mstyle></mrow></mrow></math>
content.question: Which of the following is the net ionic equation for the overall reaction that occurs as the cell operates?

choices.label: <math alttext="A g, solid, plus Z n with a positive 2 charge, aqueous, react to produce A g with a positive 2 charge, aqueous, plus Z n, solid" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>Ag</mtext><mrow><mo>(</mo><mi>s</mi><mo>)</mo><mo>+</mo><msup><mrow><mtext>Zn</mtext></mrow><mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn><mo>+</mo></mrow></mrow></msup><mrow><mo>(</mo><mi>a</mi><mi>q</mi><mo>)</mo><mo>→</mo></mrow></mrow><msup><mrow><mtext>Ag</mtext></mrow><mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn><mo>+</mo></mrow></mrow></msup><mrow><mo>(</mo><mi>a</mi><mi>q</mi><mo>)</mo><mo>+</mo><mtext>Zn</mtext><mrow><mo>(</mo><mi>s</mi><mo>)</mo></mrow></mrow></mrow></mstyle></math>

<math alttext="A g with a positive 1 charge, aqueous, plus Z n with a positive 2 charge, aqueous, plus 3 electrons react to produce A g Z n, solid" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><msup><mrow><mtext>Ag</mtext></mrow><mrow><mo>+</mo></mrow></msup><mrow><mo>(</mo><mi>a</mi><mi>q</mi><mo>)</mo></mrow><mo>+</mo><msup><mrow><mtext>Zn</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn><mo>+</mo></mrow></msup><mrow><mo>(</mo><mi>a</mi><mi>q</mi><mo>)</mo><mo>+</mo><mn>3</mn><mspace depth="0.0ex" height="0.0ex" width="0.1em"></mspace><msup><mrow><mi>e</mi></mrow><mrow><mo>−</mo></mrow></msup><mo>→</mo><mtext>Ag</mtext><mtext>Zn</mtext><mrow><mo>(</mo><mi>s</mi><mo>)</mo></mrow></mrow></mrow></mstyle></math>

<math alttext="A g with a positive 1 charge, aqueous, plus Z n, solid, react to produce A g, solid, plus Z n with a positive 2 charge, aqueous, plus 1 electron" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><msup><mrow><mtext>Ag</mtext></mrow><mrow><mo>+</mo></mrow></msup><mrow><mo>(</mo><mi>a</mi><mi>q</mi><mo>)</mo><mo>+</mo><mtext>Zn</mtext><mrow><mo>(</mo><mi>s</mi><mo>)</mo><mo>→</mo><mtext>Ag</mtext><mrow><mo>(</mo><mi>s</mi><mo>)</mo><mo>+</mo><msup><mrow><mtext>Zn</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn><mo>+</mo></mrow></msup><mrow><mo>(</mo><mi>a</mi><mi>q</mi><mo>)</mo><mo>+</mo><msup><mrow><mi>e</mi></mrow><mrow><mo>−</mo></mrow></msup></mrow></mrow></mrow></mrow></mrow></mstyle></math>

<math alttext="2 A g with a positive 1 charge, aqueous, plus Z n, solid, react to produce 2 A g, solid, plus Z n with a positive 2 charge, aqueous" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>2</mn><mspace depth="0.0ex" height="0.0ex" width="0.1em"></mspace><msup><mrow><mspace depth="0.0ex" height="0.0ex" width="0.1em"></mspace><mtext>Ag</mtext></mrow><mrow><mo>+</mo></mrow></msup><mrow><mtext>(</mtext><mi>a</mi><mi>q</mi><mtext>)</mtext><mo>+</mo><mtext>Zn</mtext><mrow><mtext>(</mtext><mi>s</mi><mtext>)</mtext><mo>→</mo><mn>2</mn><mspace depth="0.0ex" height="0.0ex" width="0.1em"></mspace><mtext>Ag</mtext><mrow><mtext>(</mtext><mi>s</mi><mtext>)</mtext><mo>+</mo><msup><mrow><mtext>Zn</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn><mo>+</mo></mrow></msup><mrow><mo>(</mo><mi>a</mi><mi>q</mi><mo>)</mo></mrow></mrow></mrow></mrow></mrow></mstyle></math>

content.answer: <math alttext="2 A g with a positive 1 charge, aqueous, plus Z n, solid, react to produce 2 A g, solid, plus Z n with a positive 2 charge, aqueous" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>2</mn><mspace depth="0.0ex" height="0.0ex" width="0.1em"></mspace><msup><mrow><mspace depth="0.0ex" height="0.0ex" width="0.1em"></mspace><mtext>Ag</mtext></mrow><mrow><mo>+</mo></mrow></msup><mrow><mtext>(</mtext><mi>a</mi><mi>q</mi><mtext>)</mtext><mo>+</mo><mtext>Zn</mtext><mrow><mtext>(</mtext><mi>s</mi><mtext>)</mtext><mo>→</mo><mn>2</mn><mspace depth="0.0ex" height="0.0ex" width="0.1em"></mspace><mtext>Ag</mtext><mrow><mtext>(</mtext><mi>s</mi><mtext>)</mtext><mo>+</mo><msup><mrow><mtext>Zn</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn><mo>+</mo></mrow></msup><mrow><mo>(</mo><mi>a</mi><mi>q</mi><mo>)</mo></mrow></mrow></mrow></mrow></mrow></mstyle></math>

skill.text: 5.E: Determine a balanced chemical equation for a given chemical phenomenon.
